paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Caucasian population, particularly in Portugal and Sweden

individual_records.evidence_sentence: TTRV30M had by far the strongest fluorescence intensity and a broader presence of deposition in the heart.
TTRV30M had by far the strongest fluorescence intensity and a broader presence of deposition in the heart.
TTRV30M had by far the strongest fluorescence intensity and a broader presence of deposition in the heart.
TTRV30M had by far the strongest fluorescence intensity and a broader presence of deposition in the heart.

functional_data.summary: TTRV30M shows a higher tendency to misfold and form unstable alternatives of monomers and dimers.

variants.population_frequency: Prevalent among the Caucasian population, particularly in Portugal and Sweden.
variants.additional_notes: V30M is the most common hATTR variant.
key_quotes: V30M (also termed TTRV30M) is the most common hATTR variant that causes TTR familial amyloid polyneuropathy (ATTR-FAP).
TTRV30M had by far the strongest fluorescence intensity and a broader presence of deposition in the heart.

patients.demographics: Individuals of African or Hispanic ancestry
patients.phenotype: elevated risks of heart failure due to cardiomyopathy (ATTR-CM)

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Carriers of V122I have elevated risks of heart failure due to cardiomyopathy.
Carriers of V122I have elevated risks of heart failure due to cardiomyopathy.

functional_data.summary: TTRV122I shows a relatively balanced distribution among tetramer, dimer, and monomer forms.

variants.population_frequency: Common in individuals of African or Hispanic ancestry.
variants.additional_notes: V122I is another common genetic variant of hATTR.
key_quotes: V122I (TTRV122I) is another common genetic variant of hATTR, and its carriers have elevated risks of heart failure due to cardiomyopathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
